actions.name: sendEmail

properties.description: The message to send.
properties.name: message
properties.label: Message

properties.description: The Bcc recipients for the message.
properties.name: bccRecipients
properties.label: Bcc recipients

properties.description: The email address of the person or entity.
properties.name: address
properties.label: Address

properties.description: The display name of the person or entity.
properties.name: name
properties.label: Name

properties.description: The body of the message. It can be in HTML or text format.
properties.name: body
properties.label: Body

properties.description: The content of the item.
properties.name: content
properties.label: Content

properties.description: The type of the content.
properties.name: contentType
properties.label: Content type

properties.description: The first 255 characters of the message body content.
properties.name: bodyPreview
properties.label: Body preview

properties.description: The Cc recipients for the message.
properties.name: ccRecipients
properties.label: Cc recipients

properties.description: The email address of the person or entity.
properties.name: address
properties.label: Address

properties.description: The display name of the person or entity.
properties.name: name
properties.label: Name

properties.description: The ID of the conversation the email belongs to.
properties.name: conversationId
properties.label: Conversation ID

properties.description: The flag value that indicates the status, start date, due date, or completion date for the message.
properties.name: flag
properties.label: Flag

properties.description: The date and time that the follow-up was finished.
properties.name: completedDateTime
properties.label: Completed Date Time

properties.description: A single point of time in a combined date and time representation.
properties.name: dateTime
properties.label: Date Time

properties.description: Represents a time zone, for example, 'Pacific Standard Time'.
properties.name: timeZone
properties.label: Time Zone

properties.description: The date and time that the follow-up is to be finished. Note: To set the due date, you must also specify the startDateTime; otherwise, you get a 400 Bad Request response.
properties.name: dueDateTime
properties.label: Due date time

properties.description: A single point of time in a combined date and time representation.
properties.name: dateTime
properties.label: Date Time

properties.description: Represents a time zone, for example, 'Pacific Standard Time'.
properties.name: timeZone
properties.label: Time Zone

properties.description: The status for follow-up for an item.
properties.name: flagStatus
properties.label: Flag status

properties.description: The date and time that the follow-up is to begin.
properties.name: startDateTime
properties.label: Start date time

properties.description: A single point of time in a combined date and time representation.
properties.name: dateTime
properties.label: Date Time

properties.description: Represents a time zone, for example, 'Pacific Standard Time'.
properties.name: timeZone
properties.label: Time Zone

properties.description: The owner of the mailbox from which the message is sent. In most cases, this value is the same as the sender property, except for sharing or delegation scenarios. The value must correspond to the actual mailbox used.
properties.name: from
properties.label: From

properties.description: The email address of the person or entity.
properties.name: address
properties.label: Address

properties.description: The display name of the person or entity.
properties.name: name
properties.label: Name

properties.description: Indicates whether the message has attachments. This property doesn't include inline attachments, so if a message contains only inline attachments, this property is false.
properties.name: hasAttachments
properties.label: Has attachments

properties.description: The importance of the message.
properties.name: importance
properties.label: Importance

properties.description: The classification of the message for the user, based on inferred relevance or importance, or on an explicit override.
properties.name: inferenceClassification
properties.label: Inference classification type

properties.description: A collection of message headers defined by RFC5322. The set includes message headers indicating the network path taken by a message from the sender to the recipient. It can also contain custom message headers that hold app data for the message.
properties.name: internetMessageHeaders
properties.label: Internet message headers

properties.description: Represents the key in a key-value pair.
properties.name: name
properties.label: Name

properties.description: The value in a key-value pair.
properties.name: value
properties.label: Value

properties.description: The message ID in the format specified by RFC2822.
properties.name: internetMessageId
properties.label: Internet message ID

properties.description: Indicates whether a read receipt is requested for the message.
properties.name: isDeliveryReceiptRequested
properties.label: Is delivery receipt requested

properties.description: Indicates whether the message is a draft. A message is a draft if it hasn't been sent yet.
properties.name: isDraft
properties.label: Is draft

properties.description: Indicates whether the message has been read.
properties.name: isRead
properties.label: Is read

properties.description: Indicates whether a read receipt is requested for the message.
properties.name: isReadReceiptRequested
properties.label: Is read receipt requested

properties.description: The unique identifier for the message's parent mailFolder.
properties.name: parentFolderId
properties.label: Parent folder ID

properties.description: The date and time the message was received.
properties.name: receivedDateTime
properties.label: Received datetime

properties.description: The email addresses to use when replying.
properties.name: replyTo
properties.label: Reply to

properties.description: The email address of the person or entity.
properties.name: address
properties.label: Address

properties.description: The display name of the person or entity.
properties.name: name
properties.label: Name

properties.description: The account that is actually used to generate the message. In most cases, this value is the same as the from property. You can set this property to a different value when sending a message from a shared mailbox, for a shared calendar, or as a delegate. In any case, the value must correspond to the actual mailbox used.
properties.name: sender
properties.label: Sender

properties.description: The email address of the person or entity.
properties.name: address
properties.label: Address

properties.description: The display name of the person or entity.
properties.name: name
properties.label: Name

properties.description: The date and time the message was sent.
properties.name: sentDateTime
properties.label: Sent date time

properties.description: The subject of the message.
properties.name: subject
properties.label: Subject

properties.description: The To: recipients for the message.
properties.name: toRecipients
properties.label: To recipients

properties.description: The email address of the person or entity.
properties.name: address
properties.label: Address

properties.description: The display name of the person or entity.
properties.name: name
properties.label: Name

properties.description: The content of the item.
properties.name: content
properties.label: Content

properties.description: The type of the content.
properties.name: contentType
properties.label: Content type

properties.description: The URL to open the message in Outlook on the web.
properties.name: webLink
properties.label: Web link

properties.description: Indicates whether to save the message in Sent Items.
properties.name: saveToSentItems
properties.label: Save to sent items
